text: I thought one option could be to port the simplified latex engine that matplotlib uses and GR adapted as well. We have the ability to draw glyphs from any font at arbitrary positions and scales, so maybe just intercepting latex strings, calling a different layouting algorithm with a font like Computer Modern, and then drawing the glyphs as usual could work. I'm not sure if that covers everything though, or if we also need to support primitives like lines in that setup (for fractions for example)
